musicalLanguage.description: The dramatic piano introduction to one of rock's greatest compositions. The opening features rich chordal harmonies with chromatic voice leading, building from a quiet Bb6 chord to the powerful vocal entry. This arrangement captures the harmonic density and dramatic arc of the original.
musicalLanguage.structure: Intro (8 bars) — Bb6-C7-F7-Bb with chromatic passing chords and dramatic build
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: The a cappella-style opening — Bb6 chord with rich voicing
Bars 3-4: Chromatic movement downward — the harmonic tension builds
Bars 7-8: The dramatic climax before the verse begins — full chordal texture
teachingGoals: Dynamic build from pp to f across a phrase
styleTips: Start extremely quietly and build gradually — the drama is in the crescendo
Voice each chord carefully — every note should ring clearly
The rubato (flexible timing) is essential — this is theatrical, not metronomic

measures.teachingNote: Bb major — the quiet opening. Place each note with intention. This is theater.
F major — the harmony opens up. Still very quiet. Building anticipation.
Eb to Dm — chromatic bass descent. The melody falls with the harmony.
C7 to F — the melody rises against descending bass. Dramatic countermotion.

measures.rightHand: D5 F4:q C5 Eb4:q Bb4 D4:q A4 C4:q
measures.teachingNote: Parallel sixths descending — both hands move down together. Rich, full texture.

measures.rightHand: G4 Bb4:q A4 C5:q Bb4 D5:h
measures.teachingNote: Ascending sixths to the climax — building dramatic intensity.

measures.rightHand: D5 Bb4 F4:q C5 A4 F4:q Bb4 G4 D4:q A4 F4 C4:q
measures.teachingNote: Full triads in the right hand — the dramatic peak. Give each chord weight.

measures.rightHand: Bb4 F4 D4:h F4 D4 Bb3:h
measures.teachingNote: Bb major resolves — two rich chords settle the drama. Pause before the verse would begin.
